title: Your Friday Briefing: A Coronation Preview
description: Also, foreign business fears grow in China.

title: South Africa Allowed Russian Plane Under U.S. Sanctions to Land at Base
description: The move could increase tensions between South Africa and the United States as it moves to isolate Moscow over the war in Ukraine.

title: W.H.O. Dismisses Covid Origins Investigator for Sexual Misconduct
description: Peter K. Ben Embarek led a contentious international investigation into the origins of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Sudanese Refugees Desperate for Safety Flee to Egypt
description: The war between two generals for power in Sudan has separated family members and driven tens of thousands to flee. Many had returned after the 2019 revolution with hopes for a more democratic future.

title: Canada’s Public Servants End Their Strike Without Remote Work Guarantee
description: The strike by abou

title: Russian Missile and Drone Strikes Shake Kyiv and Odesa After Kremlin Incident
description: Air-raid alarms were focused on the Ukrainian capital city after a drone was shot down.

title: Canada’s Public Servants End Their Strike Without Remote Work Guarantee
description: The strike by abou

title: 8 Killed in Pakistan Shootings, Including 6 Teachers
description: No group claimed responsibility for the attacks, near the Afghan border. The authorities said they believed there was a sectarian dimension to the violence.

title: The Truth About the Explosions at the Kremlin Remains Hazy
description: Kyiv and Moscow angrily blamed each other after two explosions in an apparent drone attack on the heart of Russian power, but whose outrage is real?

title: King Charles: A Life in Photos
description: Cameras have followed Britain’s new head of state since infancy. Here is a selection of memorable images from a very public life.

title: What We Know About the Explosions Over the Kremlin
description: Moscow has accused Ukraine of a drone attack aimed at assassinating President Vladimir V. Putin, without providing evidence. Kyiv has strenuously denied involvement.

title: At The Hague, Zelensky Renews Call to Prosecute Russian War Crimes
description: As international support for an independent tribunal appears to be growing, the Ukrainian leader called for “true justice” for crimes in the war.

title: Russia Blames U.S. for Apparent Drone Attack on the Kremlin
description: President Vladimir Putin’s spokesman doubled down on accusing Washington of “direct involvement” in the war in Ukraine. The U.S. has denied advance knowledge of the Kremlin incident.

title: America’s New Drug Policy
description: Bipartisan support now exists for a once-radical approach to drugs.

title: A Day After a School Shooting, Belgrade Is Consumed With Grief
description: Eight children and a security guard were killed by a 13-year-old boy who entered a school in the Serbian capital armed with pistols owned by his father.

title: Russia Fires Drones and Missiles at Kyiv After Kremlin Explosion
description: There were no reports of casualties or major damage. But the attack, and one in Kherson that left 23 dead, fueled concerns of what Russian forces may do in coming days.

title: Zelensky addresses The Hague as he pushes for a special tribunal for Russia.
His Cousin Promised a Quake-Proof Building. Then the Walls Crumbled.
description: Turkish families got wealthy off a construction system rife with patronage. A Times investigation reveals just how fatally shaky that system was.

title: Even as China Reopens, Security Visits Spook Foreign Businesses
description: Fears are growing that the Communist Party’s increasing focus on control over information about markets and companies is behind the questioning of firms.

title: Why Did Russia Choose to Publicize the Kremlin Drone Attack?
description: Russia’s messaging on a drone incident at the Kremlin diverged significantly from its response to past explosions in Russia or Russian-occupied territory.

title: Bluster over explosions raises fears of retaliation by Russia.
Your Thursday Briefing
description: Accusations of an assassination attempt on Vladimir Putin.

title: With Local Elections in Much of the U.K., Here’s What’s at Stake
description: Municipalities across England will face voters, including in areas that could sway the next national election. Here’s a guide to the ballots and how to interpret them.
